title: Ludwig model with different csv
body:
I want use this example:
Natural Language Understanding¶
utterance | intent | slots
I want a pizza | order_food | O O O   B-Food_type
Book a flight to Boston | book_flight | O O O O B-City
Book a flight at 7pm to London | book_flight | O O O O   B-Departure_time O B-City

I made about 5 experiments. The first experiment with csv N°1 and the other experiments with csv N°2:
1.	csv: Example ........., order_food, O O O **PType_1 PType_2** ......
2.	csv:  Example ........., order_food, O O O **P_TypePizza P_TypeMargerita** ......
The file *.yaml is the same for 2 csv.
Both csv files have about 1.500 rows. 
When I loaded the  models from the correct path for 2 different csv files and I made the predict, in slots I look always the PType_1 PType_2… (the variables present in the first csv), even if I uploaded the model generated with the second csv file. I expected to look in the slots the P_TypePizza instead of PType_1. I’m sure that I load the model from correct path.
So I gave another name (--experiment_name) for the second csv and I do a new experiment and I load the model from the path with the correct name experiment  but don't work. 
I expected to look in the slots the P_TypePizza (second csv) instead of PType_1 (first csv).
The data seem to me mixed (data from the first csv with data from the second csv)

Where am I doing wrong?
*.yaml:
input_features:
    -
        name: utterance
        type: text
        level: word
        encoder: rnn
        cell_type: lstm
        bidirectional: true
        num_layers: 2
        reduce_output: null
        preprocessing:
          word_format: space

output_features:
    -
        name: intent
        type: category
        reduce_input: sum
        num_fc_layers: 1
        fc_size: 64
    -
        name: slots
        type: sequence
        decoder: tagger
        
training:
  batch_size: 8
  epochs: 400
  early_stop: 40
  dropout_rate: 0.6
  learning_rate: 0.0001


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Win 10
- Python version 3.6.6
- Ludwig version 0.2.1
![DataFrame of a predict](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57320566/68479898-b9ae0a80-0233-11ea-8e32-e4f0dad98d8b.png)



**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
